Comments_List: I learned about research topics that I wasn't familiar with. Also, I learned to critically evaluate papers.
I learned how to quickly summarize a paper and describe its figures.

Paper discussion and analysis 
Reading many papers critically in a timely fashion

Assigning two papers and not going over them both in class is extremely frustrating. I think a more manageable assignment would be one paper per week, unless the professor is dedicated to discussing each at length and can manage their time effectively so we actually get to both papers.
Strengths: Good selection of topics. Interactive journal discussions.

I think it was great that the papers were available the week before. I think something that would be nice is if the instructors sent us their questions at the end of the week, and then we could send them back after like two weeks. It would be nice to have that ongoing feedback instead of a final, but that's just me personally.

The subject variety was good because of the team-taught structure. I think there could have been more feedback throughout the course, and practice answering questions that would be similar to the test. For me, there was a disconnect between what we learned in the lecture portion, the paper discussion portion, and the exam question for many of the topics.
Discussion of papers was a great strength, lack of feedback was unfortunate. Greater integration with coding would be of benefit, but I understand that is not the purpose of the class.

Strengths: 
Good organization 
Interesting topics

Weaknesses: 
More feedback on summaries
Yes, I thought it was helpful.
Depends on the students interest, the course was not challenging with a fair workload.
